title: Function Concepts - Tabular and Analytic Part A

content.question: Part A (i) The function <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mi>h</mi> </math> is defined by <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mrow> <mi>h</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>∘</mo><mi>f</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mi>g</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>f</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow> </math>. Find the value of <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mrow> <mi>h</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>5</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow> </math> as a decimal approximation, or indicate that it is not defined. Show the work that leads to your answer. (ii) Find the value of <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mrow> <msup> <mi>f</mi> <mrow> <mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow> </msup> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>4</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow> </math>, or indicate that it is not defined.

frqParts.text: Part A (i) The function <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mi>h</mi> </math> is defined by <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mrow> <mi>h</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>∘</mo><mi>f</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mi>g</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>f</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow> </math>. Find the value of <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mrow> <mi>h</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>5</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow> </math> as a decimal approximation, or indicate that it is not defined. Show the work that leads to your answer. (ii) Find the value of <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mrow> <msup> <mi>f</mi> <mrow> <mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow> </msup> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>4</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow> </math>, or indicate that it is not defined.

skill.text: Skill 2.A: Identify information from graphical, numerical, analytical, and verbal representations to answer a question or construct a model, with and without technology.
